text: Very fruity, but balanced. Sweet juiciness comes through. Thin fading head. Flavor is very tropical but I thought it was from hops not juice. Nice flavors. Nose is very tropical also. Very little bitterness.

Almost clear, dark yellow beer with a three finger high, white, fluffy head. 

Nose: Lemon, blood orange, citrus, malt, grapefruit and passion fruit. 
Taste: Fresh squeezed orange juice, lemon, caramel malt, blood orange and grapefruit. 
Mouth: Medium body and carbonation. A nice bitter mouthfeel. Smooth and juicy. 

This is a Limited Release from Lagunitas but I shure want it to come back! This is really good and refreshing. The blood orange juice and the wheat version of New Dogtown Pale Ale works great together!

Pours gold with a coarse white head, sticky lace. Fresh hop aroma, citrus, mild funk. Mouthfeel is a tad slick, refreshing though. Outstanding flavor, lovely medley of hops and oranges, not too acidic though, pleasant sweetness prevails. Slight zest, lightly toasted cereal. Super drinkable for this abv.

Bottle, 7.7% ABV. Clear gold with a white head. Aroma of sweet hay, lots of oranges. Its more - indeed too - obvious that its actual oranges when you take a swig. Moderately sweet, medium bodied, bitterness on the low side of medium. The interplay between the hops and blood oranges is really very nice, particularly at the finish. Its just so careless with the alcohol - costs it .2 or .3 for me.

Pours a light gold with a thick white head and plenty of lacing. Aroma is of citrus and malt. taste is a sweet citrus malty watery bitterness. Overall all an easy beer to drink but not one of theyre best.

32 oz crowler- Pours rusty golden with a medium white head with decent retention. Aroma is fruity, light malt, citrus, berries. The taste is fruity, berries, mango, tropical fruits, citrus, medium light bitterness. Easy drinking, was hoping for more of a hop punch, simple thirst quencher if it werent for the high abv, which i didnt even realize, doesnt taste like almost 8%.
Bottle from Lagunitas. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, orange, hops, resin and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, hops, orange, resin, grass and caramel. Very nice APA.

and for the record 5th rating of the day, we have another Lagunitas, easily my favorite and most often rated brewery and this is one of my favorite of their offerings. It pours a lovely slightly amber gold color with a fruity essence oozing out the smellholes. The taste is a sweet, sour blood orange blast with a nice hop underpinning that is compulsively drinkable yet flavorful and complex. This is a favorite of mine and I wish it was year round cause I would drink it all the time. Good for chilling out with some Danganronpa after preparing a feast for others.
Bottle. Very smooth and fruity. Taste of citrus, pine and white bread. Very drinkable as fresh.

My bottle of this was probably a little too old to be ideal, but I still thought it tasted good. It poured bright orange with average head. The aroma is sweet, tangy blood oranges up front, but a sweet wheat malt is still there in the bakcground. The flavor is mostly about the sweet citrus. Its very sweet, but not bad at all. The finish is mild and malty, and if the hop character isnt as bright as it might have been, its probably because I let this bottle set a little too long. Id like to have this again fresh.
Orange with a white lacy head. Aroma of grass, orange and bread. Tastes like unsweet orange juice and a little bitter. Medium bodied.
Nice fruity and citrus forward brew. Refreshing. Bright orange pour. Nice pale ale/fruit beer hybrid.

Orange body white head nice lacing. Citrus and troprical fruit and Resin aroma. Taste is semi bitter riches
Malty nice beer.
Bue à la pression. Blonde clair. Grosse mousse. Nez pamplemousse puissant. Palais légèrement acide, houblon discret. Belle corpulence. Finale maltée + citron.

Draft at Kaseys Tavern in Chicago. Aroma of orange zest. Lighter bodied, smooth and wheatty, a bit more carbonation wouldnt hurt. The flavor is juicy orangey hops with a bit of pine. Grassy finish with citrus zest and a vague spice palate, grains of paradise. Pretty damn good.
Clean gold color with a soapy white head of sustainable foam. Light caramel malt base in harmony with the blood orange flavor. Light citrus tang tones the sweetness down.
Bottle. Pours golden orange with a small white head. Big citrus aroma with orange, pine and grapefruit. Flavor of pale malts, citrus fruit, orange peel, grapefruit, pine and a bit of caramel.

On draft at iTAP. Citrus peel on the nose, pours a clear yellowish amber. Minimal carbonation but still very full mouthfeel. Initially heavy on the citrus but finishes with fresh, bitter hops. This is a fantastic fresh ipa and at perfect abv, 7.9%.

Draft at Craft. Hazy straw pour with frothy, white head. Nose is hops, grapefruit, tangerine, blood orange, pale malt. Smooth, juicy, hoppy, and tropical citrus in the flavor, very smooth and juicy finish. Just relax yourself, and let it flow all over your eager tongue and down your eager throat.
Tap at Fox & Hound, Philadelphia. Colour is clear orange with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, citrus, tropical fruits, hops and malts.

Pours two fingers of head on a clear straw body.
Aroma is oranges.
Taste has a nice orange sweet, then a mild lemon and grapefruit bitterness, with a orange and grapefruit bitter finish.
Texture is crisp.

On tap at Petrol Station. Pours a hazy orange with medium white head that lasts. The aroma is tropical fruit, pine, dank, resin. Medium body, pine, grapefruit, dank, lingering resin finish, oily, very good

Bottled 12/29/16. Pours very clear golden/yellow, white sudsy head. Aroma is lots of intense tangerine, orange, and pineapple, very intense, seems like an adjunct added. And after looking at the label, I can see its blood orange juice added. Yea, blood orange. Flavor is very sharp grapefruit rind, blood orange bitterness, pine. Its pretty hoppy bitter finish. That blood orange is pretty bitter. Nose feels a little adjuncty mostly because the aroma is just too obviously blood orange, flavor less so. Solid. A little one dimensional, and finishes a bit too bitter, but not a bad job.
Draft. Pours gold with a white head. Citric base, mild bitterness, juicy citric sweetness, mild pale malts, and a nice citric hoppy finish. Very drinkable.

Tap at SF Beer Week Opening Gala.

Pours clear golden.
Aroma: Nicely fruity, tropical, blood orange, some citrus, but clearly not a strong beer.
Medium body, some sweetness but not much, still a good mouthfeel, oily.
Short but fruity palate. Okay
Big citrus nose, mainly orange. Taste follows with a nice hop bite. Nice pale finish with a lingering bitterness. Nice.
It has a very intense citrus flavor as advertised. May have been a bit to fruity for me but damn it was good.

12oz bottle, pours hazy faded clear yellow, medium head and sheeting lacing. 
Notes of wheat beer, hay, bitter citrus, citrus pith, some blood orange coming through. 
Nice bitterness throughout with a lingering bitter finish. 
Paired very nicely with spicy Indian food.
$16.99/12 pack @ Total Wine & More, Boca Raton, Florida

Bottle: The aroma consists of huge citrus/orange with light grapefruit and orange peel. It pours a transparent golden-orange with a touch of haze and a two finger white head that settles to a thick film. There is a good amount of soapy webbing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with moderate citrus with a hint of peach. The finish has moderate-heavy orange with light-moderate grapefruit and citrus peel. Its light-medium bodied with light-moderate carbonation. Overall, its very refreshing and drinkable.
Pretty good brew; matched the hop flavor up with the malt fairly well tho its a little heavy in bitterness. Great body and finish.

$2.00 bottle from Wine Warehouse. Pours golden with floaters, small off-white head. Heavy aroma of fresh fruit: orange & peach. Flavor is tangy orange peel, pine, caramel malts, white pepper. Prickly finish.
On tap at Mirror Twin Brewery. Big citrus aroma with some spruce as well. Highly drinkable.
Clear yellow orange pour with an off white and nice lacing. Aroma is orange, pine, and toffee. Taste is strong citrus, some pine and toffee. Light medium body. Very easy drinking.

Bottle from Js. Pours a clear gold with a finger of foam that lingers. Huge white grapefruit, tangerine and blood orange nose. Super refreshing with good grapefruit and citrus character on the palate. Clean and crisp finish with good fruit character. Not sweet and all, hops and fruit well integrated. Nice one.

Shared 12 oz. bottles poured to snifters, showing a hazed, orangey gold color, with a presentable layer of white head, and dots & dashes of lacing. The nose was fruity but somewhat artificial scent of Kool-Aid-like sweetness, soft grain, and citrus as orange, with some lemony tanginess. Light to medium bodied, with fair carbonation, the taste was similar notes, adding citrusy bitterness, with as bit of rind-like astringency that lingered, hidden alcohol, and continued tartness & tanginess. A decent, fruit-centric Pale.

Keg Half Pint at Waterloo Tap, London in May 2016 - Crystal Clear Pale Gold in colour. Good creamy off-white head. Excellent lacing. Very Fruity; tangy orange and grapefruit citrus and some tropical fruits. Hoppy; piney resinous hops. Malty; wheaty malts, caramel. Nice balance. Bittersweet very fruity hoppy throughout. Easy drinking for ABV. Enjoyed this. Very nice fruity IPA! (2016-05-12)

Tap at Lagunitas Seattle. Slightly hazy orange color with small white head. Aroma is huge citrus fruits, blood orange, yes, piney, and a dash of toasted malts. Taste is blood orange and other citrus fruits, grassy, a bit tart, some wheat. Solid bitterness in the finish, silky malt body. Very nice!
Pours gold with a small white head. Aroma is citrus, floral and more citrus. Taste is bitter with some light sweetness. Medium bodied, dry finish.
TJs. Dark orange and hops. Malts, wheat. Really well balanced. Hoppy blood orange ale. How can you go wrong?
Bottle - Pours orange, white head. Big citrus with diesel piney notes. Not too bitter. Nice!

Bottle from Bruisin Ales. Pours orange with a white head. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Has some solid orange notes on the nose. Nice blend of floral hops and orange on the tongue. Finished clean. Nice.

Color is hazy gold. Nose is citrusy. Orange peel, hops, melon, and something "tart". Taste uses citrus (oranges) to balance the hops. Fruity notes throughout with a nice mild finish. No alcohol taste, despite 7.9 ABV. Mouthfeel is light and almost airy. 

*12 oz bottle into pint glass 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught at Bierhaus, Cork. Clear amber pour. Strog citrus hop aroma. Blood orange is really prominent. Nice sticky citrus with a bitter finish. One of the best from these guys in a while.

12 ounce bottle, 4/13/15. Clear golden, large foamy white head. Good retention. Aroma of wheat and orange peel. The taste is bright, juicy, tart oranges, wheat, pale malt. Medium bodied, juicy, maybe a little too much so.
It has the Lagunitas signature hoppiness along with more than a citrusy aroma. This one has the taste to match.
BBOTMC. Pours amber with a nice head, aroma of malt, marmalade, toffee, flavor is bitter with citrus, orange, lemon, medium bodied.

Pale yellow with a two-finger white head and very nice lacing. Big orange aroma followed by mild pine. Flavor follows, with orange and pine featured, with support from a caramel malt foundation. Medium body, lively carbonation, creamy mouthfeel and a citrusy finish.

Pours pale gold with a thick white head. Aroma is ripe red grapefruit with a little seltzer. Taste initially is grapefruit rind, followed by a salty-seltzer quality. Then comes fully ripe red grapefruit followed by a long pine tree inspired bitter finish. Nice.
Pours bubbly gold. Aroma is light citrus and floral notes. Light and crisp citrus taste medium to light bodies. Finishes smooth. Above aveagea and very drinkable ipa

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with a white head. Taste oranges, citrus, mildly sweet. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap. The look is clear, fruit, golden, lacing white head. The smell is a ton of fruit, hops, pine, tangerine, orange, good stuff. The taste is hoppy, a lot of citrus fruit flavors, and pretty decent.

Definitely an IPA, but a damn good one for sure. Dank and citrusy. The blood oranges play so nicely with the tropical hop notes. Really delicious. This would become my go to ipa if the abv were a little lower I think...

[Bottle (12oz)] Pours a deep bubbly gold with tons of little floaties and an average size semi-lasting frothy white head. Some minimal lacing. Big, fruity, citrusy hop aroma (7+) along with some alcohol, light herbs, light vegetal notes and bready malt in the back. Flavour mostly follows but is a touch watery and doesnt quite come together. The finish is also a bit iffy. Average bodied. Just good, not great.

A lemony citrus aroma, clear golden color with a short lasting white head with good lacing. A refreshing citrus taste, lemons, oranges and dry hops. Medium body with a dry hop and citrus finish. A great beer for the summer, very refreshing.
Bottle to shaker glass, pours clear golden with lots of suspended particle matter, this is certainly an old sample and will rate again when I get a fresh sample. For now Ill give it a 2.5.

Draught at BA, Vasagatan
Deep golden with a white head. 
Light, cereal, citric aroma. 
Very citric flavour, almost tart. Refreshing!
Medium to high bitterness.

Clean, delicious citrusy aroma. Crystal clear pale yellow with a white head. Lots of juicy lemon/orange citrus in the flavor with a touch of orange juice sweetness to balance the full bodied but not overpowering bitterness. Really nice balance of competing flavors here. A light floral note shows up in the middle along with a soft wheat character. I cant believe this is almost 8% ABV! It doesnt seem even close to that by taste as theres no bite to it, but its there nevertheless. Long lasting puckery, juicy citrus and a more green grass bitterness left on the tongue. This is one delicious citrusy IPA! This needs to be a regular or at least a repeating seasonal.

Bit of a fail. Smells of not much. Pours dull gold with no head. Sour without being free or tart. Neither an IPA nor a sour nor a proper citrus IPA. It doesnt work. Start of the Heineken rot perhaps.

2016 bottle. Brassy gold color topped by a huge rocky white head and clinging lace. Big fruity malt nose with notes of orange and Vidalia onions. First sip is more toasted malt and citrus hops. Noticeable tart orange character. More onion in middle, with hints of dried apricot and spicy hops. Finishes tart and dry. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Hazy gold body with a frothy white head, diminishing. Aroma of resin, pine, grapefruit, toasted grain. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Taste of resin and citrus  much like grapefruit juice with pine and resin on the side. Its not that pleasant of a combination.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Tom L place. Thanks Tom. Clear yellowish with white head. Aroma of citrus (grapefruit, orange) and flowers. Very citrusy flavor (grapefruit, orange, lemon), sour and bitterish, some graininess, a bit salty. Medium-bodied.

Bottle sample, thanks Tom. Clear golden with a creamy head. Aroma of orange, lemon and pine. Sweetish with sour citrusy notes, flavors of pineapple, grapefruit, lemon, plesant bitterness. Medium-bodied, smooth texture.Nice.

Draft @ Beer Ditch, Malmö. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy orange aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter blood orange flavor. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy bitter finish.

Tallahassee, Fl - ABC Fine Wine & Spirits - 12 oz bottle. Very slight haze to the light golden pour, off-white bubbly head that fades quickly. Aroma is a bit muddled, pick up some citrus, just a touch of spruce. Flavor has some hints of orange marmalade, a touch of coriander, some apricot sour fruitiness, orange pulp in the finish. Pleasantly thick mouthfeel.

On tap at Lagunitas tap room, Pataluma (CA, USA). Clear orange color, white foam. Nose: zest, lemon, lemonade. Mouth: velvety lemon/citrus character, citra/garlic after taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg at the Waterloo Tap, 04/05/16.
Clear golden copper with a well appointed egg shell white head that retains well. 
Nose is juicy citric peel, light bread, pine resin, orange marmalade, orange wine gums.
Taste carries off a zesty orange jamboree, pine, sweet malts, caramel, mango, pine resin. 
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, sticky tropicana and a rising boost in the close.
Solid citric lead IPA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 12 oz bottle. Poured a clear gold with a small lasting off white head. Aromas blood orange and grapefruit. Palate was light bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of blood orange and light grapefruit with a smooth dry bitter lingering blood orange finish.

Tap at Whole Foods Vintage Park. Pours a clear orange color with a thin white head. Aroma is hoppy, citrus, definite orange aromas, faint caramel grains. Taste is citrusy, orange, faint pineapple, a bit of a tart hit in the finish from the blood oranges. Juicy! Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Very interesting and well done beer!

yes I smell the oranges along with some piney hops..spice and doughiness..appearance..pretty yellow for having blood oranges in there but whos quibbling foamy all white head with plenty of lacing...tastes good citrusy and lemony with a yeasty slightly spicy background..like a saison really rather light on the palate but refreshing in its own way..overall lives up to its name in a way a light refreshing summery beer
Bottle. Orange with an off white head. Wow, big citrus here! Very juicy, but dry and bitter. massive dinkability here for summer
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass. The appearance is a clear golden yellow with visible sediment. The head is medium sized and white. The aroma is a big hop smell with some citrus. The taste is hops and more hops with citrus blended in nicely.
Bottle into I PA glass. Pours a clear golden colour with white head. Aroma is pretty much blood orange. Taste is about the same.
Keg at Euston Tap. A bit underwhelmed with this. Fruit gum taste and sugary mouthfeel. Lots of orange, but devoid of that classic Citra taste that I crave. Fine I suppose.
Tap..Pour is clear gold wirh a thin white head...Nose is soft citrus, honey, light bitterness, citrus rind, ...Taste is some blood orange, bold hops, sticky, sugar...

Light citrus aroma...slightly flowery...beer looks like it has floaties in it...taste is of lightly sweet grapefruit with some floweryness...slowly dissipates but stays about the same flavor...interesting....no depth but long lasting consistency...
Pours a golden orange color. Aromas of orange peel and citrus hops. Flavor of light malt and serious citrus.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2016 Bottle from Beer Wine & Co. Pale gold body with medium white head. Nose is of hops, citrus. Taste similar of hops, creamy citrus bursts, with nice floral notes. Kind of wheaty. Finishes really nice. Well done.

Bottle pour into tulip glass from Andover Liquors. Aroma is strong citrus, grapefruit with some corn chip/egg. Appearance is tons of sediment (orange?) held in suspension (it looks like jello and theres so much it almost feels like looking through a kaleidoscope--but I dont like pulp in my OJ either) in light yellow/gold liquid, with trace sparkle at sides of glass. Finger-width fizzy white head with poor retention and no lacing. Taste is initial confusion of non-distinct bitter and sweet, with latter half sweet orange. Palate is medium bodied with slick texture, lively carbonation and bitter over sweet dominant finish. Overall, this is a much better idea than its execution. The aromas a little off, the appearance is a complete disaster and only the last half of the taste and palate are redeeming. Needs work.

Bottle from Boise Co-op. Not picking up huge citrus notes, but theyre there poking around in the background. Pale golden, with wispy head and streaky lacing. Citrus aroma (OK, there it is), taste brings some crispness and a nice hops bite. Decent pale ale.

12 ounce bottle. Brassy gold color topped by a huge rocky white head and clinging lace. Big fruity malt nose with notes of orange and Vidalia onions. First sip is more toasted malt and citrus hops. Noticeable tart orange character. More onion in middle, with hints of dried apricot and spicy hops. Finishes tart and dry. Billed as an IPA, but more of a fruit beer.

Appearance: clear pale gold with one finger of rocky white head, good retention and lacing. (4/5) Aroma: juicy citrus, dank pine resin, pale malt, catty/garlic. (7/10) Taste: moderate sweet, moderate-high bitter. (7/10) Palate: medium slightly oily body, moderate carbonation, off-dry lingering slightly sticky bitter finish. (4/5)

Dunno what this is hopped with - my Google-fu fails on that count - but whether its Citra, Simcoe, or whatever, Im getting a touch more cattiness (garlic/onion/vegetal) than I prefer. Not a whole lot, but enough that I cant rate this any higher. Other than that, a solid brew. Ive called it an APA here, since the label just calls it a Pale, but it bridges styes with A/IPA: the colour and body are APA-ish, but the ABV and flavour are definitely beefy enough to be considered an A/IPA. Then again, despite the higher ABV, it drinks like a session ale. I guess, call it a Pale and have done with it? (15/20)

Type: 12-oz. bottle
Glass: Lagunitas mason jar
From: Barons in Alpine, Calif.
Price: $2.17
Purchased: April 22, 2016
Consumed: April 22, 2016
Misc.: Born on Feb. 15, 2016 at 12:11 a.m. PT; Reviewing this as an APA despite it being 7.9 pct.

Not sure why it has taken so long to pull the trigger on this one, but I picked it up today. Looking forward to it because Lagunitas is one of my favorite breweries (top 5 with my overall rating) and Im digging this one-hitter series. Dont know much about this one in particular, but still expecting it to be good.

Poured a golden, pale, clear color with 3-to-4 fingers of rocky, white head. Lots of bubbles coming up from the bottom of the glass. Good amount of foamy layered lacing on the sides of the glass. Excellent retention. (Sight - 4.50)

Smelled sharp, juicy citrusy notes from the beginning with tropical notes coming in late. Specifically got tangerine, blood orange, red grapefruit, nectarine, peach, lemon zest, lime, passion fruit, pineapple, caramel sweetness that is normal to Lagunitas beers and some danky pine. (Smell - 4.00)

Taste arguably was better with first mouthful. Cant believe how juicy this is, getting blood orange, nectarine, sweetened iced tea with lemon, red grapefruit, passion fruit, mango, pineapple, watered down pulpy orange juice, apricot (more than peach), stone fruit and some caramel sweetness. (Taste - 4.25)

Light body. Oily texture. Average carbonation. Long, citrusy finish. (Feel - 4.00)

This was a very nice American Pale Ale. Im pretty sure if I would have reviewed this as an IPA, the ratings wouldnt have been as good. Reminding me somewhat of a Maine Company beer. Would like to see a collab there. (Overall - 4.25)

4.18 93 A-

Bottle. Clear gold with a big sudsy white head that has excellent retention. The aroma is soft with mixed citrus. The taste was also mixed citrus dominated by oranges. There was also a distracting onion, chemically component to the taste that really bugged me. The palate is full and sticky. Overall: I think I got a bad batch, never before have I been disappointed by a Lagunitas beer.

Bottle.

A- Oranges, lemons, mangoes, grass, dank, citrus.

A- Yellow color, clear liquid, white head.

T- Dank, bitter, grass, herbs, blood oranges, lemons, tangerines.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, balanced finish.

O- Maybe one of my new favorite IPAs. Solid beer with the right amount of citrus that makes for a very juicy and refreshing brew. Not too bitter or aggressive. I drank this like it was 3% not 8%. Now I just need another.

2015 BJCP Category: 18B American Pale Ale
AROMA: Strong citrusy hop aroma, especially orange and grapefruit. IPA-level hoppiness in the nose. No malt presence. Clean and bright. 10/12APPEARANCE: Dark gold to amber proper hue. Mostly clear but particulates float in suspension. Average, white, foamy head. Good retention and lacing. 2/3FLAVOR: Strong bitterness right away. Citrusy hop flavor is quite strong with some grassy notes on the second half and aftertaste. Some blood orange taste comes through at the end. Base malt is mostly nondeScript. General amber/blonde character but not especially sweet. IBUs probably too high for the style, but otherwise enjoyable. 16/20MOUTHFEEL: Medium+ body. Fairly crisp. Some lingering bitterness, but its tolerable. No alcohol warmth. Feels lighter than the ABV. 5/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: Interesting and impressive brew: an imperial pale ale with blood orange juice. Hoppy and bitter enough to be considered a standard IPA. Not fruity enough to be a fruit beer proper. 8/10TOTAL SCORE: 43/50

A good brew but a bit too sweet and lacking punch for me. Delightful aroma of orange, citrus juices and a light zesty hop note, mild pine. Light caramel and bready malts a bit of toast and a pinch of spice with a leafy green hop. Citrus throughout without a ton of biterness. Juicy and a touch too sweet.

Bottle. Better Beer Of The Month Club. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma of citric hops and oranges. Mildly to moderately sweetish flavor, with some malt, lots of orange, and bitter grapefruity hops. Medium-bodied. Nice.

A fairly clear bright golden with large bubbly head. Smells of blood orange, grapefruit, slight chemical. Taste is a mildly bitter citrus hop with a touch of sour. Has some citrus pulp bitterness, grapefruit, a little salt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sample at The Walrus. Clear copper color with a medium thin white head that diminishes steadily to a film. Short strings of lacing. Citrus, hops and malt in the news. Medium body with flavors of grapefruit, herbal hops and grainy malt. The finish is moderately bitter with a short citrusy hops aftertaste. Decent overall.
6flight tap at Geraghtys Pub, Burlington, nj. Bright floral citrus nose, golden with a hint of grapefruit or orange. Nice easy finish, these hops are mellow and unobtrusive.
Bottle. Pours a nice straw gold color. Nose is juicy hops and tropical fruit. Juicy, flowery, nice mild bitterness. Nice beer

Shaker pint draft at Yard House in Addison, Texas. The pour is mostly clear darker golden with a one inch fizzy off white head. The aroma is bright citrus orange, floral hop and a bit of caramel malt. The taste is strong on the blood orange flavor right away, bright and tart, balanced with the floral, finishing with mineral caramel malt. The palate is medium bodied, high carbonation and fruit citrus in the finish. Fun beer.

Bottle, bbotmc. Clear gold with a white head. Aroma of orange peel, white grapefruit and some candied citrus peel . tastes bitter, at first piney and then citrusy. Light body, hoppy orange juice finish.

12 oz. Bottle. Purchased at Prost, North Hampton, NH. Aroma is pretty bright with pink grapefruit rind, blood orange, tangerine. Wow! 
Pale malts and wheat provide the base. Pine hops are in conflict with the citrus hops. Pine wins out a bit and is lightly astringent. I wish the flavor was as bright with citrus as the nose. Medium body with lively carb. I loved the aroma but the battle of citrus and pine in the flavor didnt totally win me over. Still worth a pint and it could fair better on draft.
Clear gold, with a citrus and malt aroma. Taste is very sharply citrusy, and yeah, I gotta say, blood orange makes it into the glass. Strange beer into the finish, but good.

Pours a medium gold with yeast bits. Light head. Smell is kinda minerally, little sweet caramel, some almost minty orange tart floral. Taste is same but fairly malty but not sweet malty, tart orange citrus. Cant say I would like this say it would be 5% abv, because the malt body makes up for that in this. Pretty good but dont think I would get a sixer of it again.

Pours clear amber with a thick, frothy pale buff head. Aroma presents orange and hoppy notes, not strong but inviting. Flavor delivers bolder notes than the aroma, orange and hops plus some grapefruit and a little fresh malt. Mouthfeel features so-so body but some good fizz. Get hopping for some Citrus.

Crispy orange aroma. Light golden amber body with a hint of sediment floating aroma. Healthy one fingered foamed head . A bitter orange citrus taste. Hint of citrus sweetness. Has an interesting tang to the palate. Not your average IPA.

Pours a new clear amber from a bottle. My first bottle was a nice citrusy pale ale, definite blood orange notes with some nice hoppiness. Second bottle is only okay, I think maybe palate fatigue comes early on this one for some reason. Good beer.
Golden pour. Clear. Small white head. No lacing. Aroma of earth and orange. Orange taste with a watery bitterness.

Pours a slightly hazy golden hue with a finger of fizzy foam. Lots of blood orange on the nose with bits of soft grain, pine and a soft fruitiness. Palate follows with some aggressive tart orange flavors that linger with a strong bitterness. Interesting brew that has its moments but also is a bit abrasive at times. Good with tacos !

12oz bottle. Clear light amber body topped by medium off-white head. Aroma is moderately sweet, blood orange, some grapefruit. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit/grapefruit juice, light lemon. Medium body, some effervescence, light acidity.
12 oz bottle. Pours clear light golden color. Aroma of citrus, grass, orange, very clean. Flavor is citrus, orange, grain, floral. A bitterness of orange peel and hop comes through in the finish.

355ml bottle pours a clear golden orange color with a 2 finger white head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is oranges with some hints of grapefruit and cereal grains. Taste is an orange and malty sweetness with a light grapefruit hop bitterness. Light to medium bodied with average carbonation. Overall, maybe a bit too much orange juice and not enough orange peel, as it comes off too sweet.

This beer did not smell very citric to me, the way that Ballast Point Grapefruit Sculpin or Terrapin Walking Dead Blood Orange IPA did.  The aroma was mostly typical for a pale ale, with just a touch of citrus, that could very well be mistaken for more hops.  The taste is where the orange juice showed up in a big way.  There was a concentrated orange sourness at the beginning of each sip.  The sourness gave way to orange pith bitterness mid palette, and the finish was a long drawn out taste of blood orange. After that lackluster smell, I was not expecting a beer this good.  Well done Lagunitas.

Half at the pelt trader. This is great, very tangy, citrusy as the name suggests. Powerful alcohol but quite refreshing. A good drop.
Draught at The Beer Trappe. Big tangerine aroma and taste, Malty sticky goodness. Big for a Pale.

Pour on tap at Crunchys hazy orange pour with white head, aroma brought notes of nice orange peel, orange juice, touch of grapefruit, hints of bread, biscuit, some lemon. Taste was a mix of lemon, orange, grapefruit into a bit of yeast, slight biscuit, finishing fairly bitter, slightly orange juice-like.

On cask at Ushers.
Appearance - golden with a decent head. 
Nose - grapefruit and sweat. 
Taste - more of the same. 
Palate - light to medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry finish. 
Overall - yep tasty.

Clear brilliant golden with a thin and sticky white cap. Big punchy nose with orange zest and earthy citrusy hop bitterness. Smooth and sweet flavor featuring loads of orange zest and orange flesh, then theres a balanced citrusy bitterness and a slightly piney bitter finish. Semisweet and orangey overall.

Bottled. Poured medium orange with quite a bit of sediment. The aroma picked up juicy blood orange and other citrus over a sweet caramel and bready base.. smelled fresh and refreshing. The flavor found tart, bitter blood orange on the tip of the tongue through the finish.. the sweet cara malt base was a little slick.. finished with a feel closer to orange juice than beer (mostly due to low carbonation). Light-medium bodied and slick through the palate.. OK feel.. definitely refreshing.

On tap at Rose Alley. A clear light orange brew. Notable aromas and flavor of orange and citrus, as advertised. Clean malt profile. Good hop balance. I am not a big Pale Ale fan, but this one is on the better side.
I love this beer. Very refreshing. Has some very strong orange and grapefruit flavor with citrus and tropical hop notes. Like most Lagunitas brews, has a sweet malt body.
12 oz bottle. Clear burnt orange, tight off white head, no lace. Aroma is citrus, floral hops, bready malts. Flavor is sweet juicy orange, grapefruit, tropical fruit, sweet-tart candy, bready malt.

Draft at Lizardville in Akron. Pours a slight muddy orange with ample head. The aroma is solid citrus oranges lemons and starfruit. Taste was great balance of citrus and malts. Great medium body and carb. Overall just a great all around pale ale.

12oz bottle. Pours slightly hazy orange. Small white head, prevalent lacing. Aroma is hopped citrus. Flavor is just, WOW. Ridiculous citrus explosion after the initial hop. Orange, mango, stonefruit. Complex, bittering slightly at the end. Not sure Ive ever had a comparable beer before. Moderately high carbonation, slightly creamy. Strange and delicious.

Draft at Moriartys. Clear orange gold pour with some white foam that left thick lace. Huge tropical citrus flavors. Orange. Banana. Watermelon. Lemon. Coconut. Pineapple. Cherry. Cantaloupe. Lime. Does not taste specifically like Blood Oranges to me. Feels a bit too much like a mouthful of Jolly Ranchers.

How: Draught.
Where: Babajan, Stockholm.
Appearance: Clear golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Some citrus, malt, a bit of hops, some grapefruit.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, citrus, fruit, some hops.
Had a Boulder Tap House in Mankato Minnesota. One of the best summer citrusy beers I have ever had. Reminded me a bit of Hop Valleys Citrus Mistress but with a bit more fruit sweetness.

12 ounce bottle - $2.49 at Total Wine & More in Alpharetta, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours a slightly hazed, cheerfully orange-tinged body with a smallish, white head.

Smell: With such a fruity, juicy, citrusy nose, I found it quite likable. Subdued bready malt tones and an overall though restrained sweet-scented quality to the aroma.

Taste: Pale malts, lightly grainy with a little golden syrup sweetness in the fore. Citrusy, its got a lovely, juicy blood orange pop, but also a lemon-lime vibe and a backing of mango. Moderately bitter. Drying on the back half but still charmingly citrusy through the finish with some light, lingering resinous hints.

Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium carbonation, nearingly crisp.

Overall: Pleasantly simple, easy drinking with the extra added boost from the oranges for an overall citrusy, tropical taste.
Classic golden pour. Resinous hop nose. Full bodied, slightly oily, and good, balancing carbonation. Oniony apple flavors. Faint sour apple at the finish.

Aroma citrus, Orange, 
Appearance golden, hazy, cloudy, frothy, white foam, 
Taste light sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate medium body, fizzy, 
Overall the best blood Orange beer I have had to date. It tastes natural and not fake. I enjoyed it very much.
Draft pour avg gold with moderate white head. Nose big resin, orange, tropical fruit. Smells great. Taste big tropical fruit hop, citrus, juicy. Minimal grainy malt just early mid palate. Very tasty.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2017 Medium gold, clear, tall and lasting head. Full body, smooth texture, assertive and concentrated flavor, fairly hot, long palate with a flavorful finish. Very bitter but well balanced by sweetness in background. Delicious and exotic flavor, not exactly juicy but hoppy and definitely citrusy, A lot of personality, definitely not a session beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours cloudy orange amber with low white head. Aroma of pine, citrus, grapefruit, peach. Taste is rich pine and citrus bitter with a smooth fruit sweet finish. Light, velvety body with soft carbonation.

Keg at the Euston Tap. Strong aromas of powdered orange, pine. Taste is strong orange, pine, some grapefruit. Small alcohol kick. Well balanced. 

EDIT - at the end of the glass and its numbing my tongue slightly.
Pours a bright golden color with a clean foamy white head. A hopped tropical aroma. Big orange peel flavor. A ton of citrus. Piney background with a big blood orange on the tongue. Good stuff.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2015 Pours a light Orange with floating particles and decent head. Aroma is tangerine peel, grapefruit peel,some lemon. Taste follows the aroma well with a decent malt backbone. Its ok but its a fruit peel type of bitterness thats off putting. Would rather get that character with hops. Disappointed with this one overall especially coming from one of my favorite breweries.

On tap at Battleship. Pours a hazy orange with white head. Aroma is of big time citrus (already a plus in my book), grapefruit, hops, slight pine, and wheat. Nice lacing. Flavor is of orange, grapefruit, hops, grass and pine. Fresh fruit and a semi-dry finish. Great stuff!!!!

This draft brew from a restaurant poured a head of foamy finely sized white colored bubbles that were quickly diminishing and left behind a very softly carbonated transparent light yellow orange colored body and a fair lacing. The sharp aroma was citrus. The vinous mouth feel was very tingly at the start and at the finish with a lingering hoppy aftertaste. The strong flavor contained notes of citrus and hops. A decent one that I would consider drinking again.

Dark orange with a small white head. The aroma contains a ton of orange with spices and perfume. The flavor is bitter with blood oranges and a lot of pine going on. Well balanced and reisny. Overall good IPA.

Poured up on tap at the Brass Tap in Mesa, AZ where it exhibits a clear deep gold body that has copper hues and supports a white head of foam. The aroma offers up inviting notes of mango, tangerine and cantaloupe with a mild sweet maltiness in the background. The taste delivers smooth almost soft tangelo and mango and cantaloupe juicy fruitiness that is quickly building into citrus hop bitterness. Oh my. Toward the finish modest juiciness takes over for the bitterness just as a mild pleasing cracker malt note bubbles to the surface. Sweet baby jesus this is good!
Bottle shared by Simmons - thanks! Big citrus aroma and taste. Juicy sweet. Well balanced and crushable. Excellent!
Keg at the hanging bat. Pours clear golden, nose is toffee, herbal, taste is salty, toffee, citrus.

20th June 2015Euston Tap. Keg. Clear gold amber beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light and a little soft but still has good fine carbonation. Mild and semi sweet pale malts, touch of cream. Lovely fruits - good ripe mango and fresh orange. Mild floralness and then a light bitterness before an airy finish. A real fruity treat, just lets go of the intensity a little in the finish but still amazing.

K, the positive: you dont taste the alcohol. The negative: its just too much orange for me. The way that it all comes together just isnt something Ill want to have a lot more of. Id still choose it over any macro brew, so, it at least gets a 3.x, but I think I was expecting something else.

Keg at the hanging bat... Golden amber... Small white head.. Soft sweet floral orange fruits... Light passion fruit.. Soft caramel toffee nose... Juicy orange.. Light dty tart orange.. Soft peppery orange fruits
Keg at the Hanging Bat. Pours pale gold, light haze, thin white head. Aromas of orange peel, grapefruit. Taste is lime bitter, very bitter orange finish.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a clear gold color with a brief white head and a lot of particulates. Strong aroma of citrus hops. Medium body, taste leans heavily to the hop side although it's not overwhelming. Finish continues with the citrus theme. Very good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: Mild Citrus, Mild Malts

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw/Amber Hue, Passes Some Light, Thin White Head Ring, Decent Lacing

Taste: Sweet Malts, Mild Citrus, Mild Sweet Orange

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying, Mildly Sweet

Lightly hazy golden colored body, medium to thin white head, spotty lacing. Bright orange juice, grapefruit, light honey, and florals. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation, mild fruity sweetness, moderate to lively bitterness, clean finish.
Draft. Slightly hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is immediate orange sighs light graininess. Taste is mostly a bitter pithiness with a dried orange lingering bitterness as well. Meh.

Draft to taster at HopCat in Indy. This beer was listed as CitruSinesis on the beer menu, so Im not sure which is the correct title. Looks good; a mostly transparent gold with foamy head that is somewhere. Between white and eggshell. Smells good too; juicy hops with a nicely balanced orange presence alongside a mildly bittersweet backbone. Tastes like it smells, but more orange-forward, with a resinous medium-bodied mouthfeel. Enjoyable, but smells better and more balanced than it tastes.

12 oz. bottle, pale hazy orange pour. Bright aromas of oranges and lemons. Sweet caramel malts, with intense grapefruit, oranges and pine flavors that jump out at ya. Delicious and refreshing with a semi dry finish. I want more.

Cool idea, and I think it really works. Tons of orange flavor, amped up a little by the hops. Very juicy, fresh flavor. Pours hazy golden with pretty good head and lacing. Finishes sweet, sour and bitter at the same time. Some hint of hay in there, but focus here is fruit. Very well balanced. Bottle from Franklins.

12oz from the COOP... picked up last week and finally getting to the bottle tonight.. Pours a mostly clear light orange with an okay white head and lacing.. Nose shows orange juice and zest.. beer notes are relatively quiet.. cracker pale malt.. Flavor is pithy citrus zest and the same juicy elements as the aroma.. Bitter as expected and just sorta juicy with little standard "beer" actually tying things together.. Medium body with a burning acidic carbonation... I know I will be in the minority, but I dont care for this one at all.

Clear copper body with minimal head. Aroma is oj, floral hops and a little alcohol. Obviously the flavor is dominated by citrus from the juice and the hops which combine quite well. Theres some tanginess and bread beneath the citrus to keep things from getting out of hand. Super smooth body with just the right amount of carb. Yet another example of how citrus + hops in a pale ale is the best summer style.

Pour is a cloudy orange with a large white head. Aroma is a outstanding combo of the hop and orange juice citrus. Flavor is a super bitter and tart fruit juice. The hops and blood orange probably fight it out a bit too much but this is like fresh squeezed juice you would have on a Sunday morning. Very fresh and great tasting.

12 oz bottle. Misty orange with a smooth white head. Nose is orange, musk, lemon zest, pineapple and dough. Crisp medium body with soft carb and lingering resin. Taste also starts with fresh orange juice but not so sweet. Grapefruit peel, juniper, sour peach and earthy grass add complexity if a bit strange.

Pours medium orange with a one finger white head with nice lacing. Aroma is of citrus (grapefruit and lemon), lemon balm, pine, and tropical fruits. Taste is similar to the aroma with the addition of some light bready malts. Has a medium body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, moderately bitter, medium-long finish. Overall, a tasty, very citrus forward pale ale.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2015 Growler thanks to Terrance Jamaal. Superspak had this to say: " 12 ounce bottle into tulip glass. bottled on 6/4/2015. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy deep golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense off white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with some light streaming carbonation. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, lemon zest, orange peel, pine, honey, cracker, bread, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great complexity and balance of bright citrus/piney hops, blood orange, and pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, lemon zest, orange peel, pine, honey, cracker, old man cum, bread, and floral/grassy earthiness. Fair amount of pine/grassy bitterness and slight fruit tartness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, lemon/orange peel, pine, honey, cracker, bread, and floral/grassy monkey spluge on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of bright citrus/piney hops, blood orange, and pale malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness/tartness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, fairly crisp/sticky, and slightly acidic mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warmth lingering like a Muslim orgy after the finish. Overall this is an excellent fruited pale ale. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/piney hops, blood orange, and pale malt flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering." He gave it a 4.1
Growler from Gravity pours light gold and very clear. Strong citrus fruit aroma. Taste is all oranges. Odd after taste. Good and interesting but not very complex.

Tap @ Bishops Arms, Hornsgatan. Clear golden, small but compact white head. Very hoppy aroma, orange, grapefruit, lemon zest. Medium body with a fruity and fresh mouthfeel. Hoppy citrus taste, grapefruit, blood orange, Tangerine, orange, ripe mango. Grapefruit bitter finish.
On tap at cask republic.blood orange and citra makes for great aroma.tasty stuff. Get grapefrit., orange and hop.Some lace.
Thx bro! Pale orange pour. Little head. Citrus, light wheat. Tangy. Oranges come through more in the flavor. Lil Sumpin Orange?? 13.7

Draught. Pours a clear, golden yellow with a small, creamy, white head that laces. Strong citrus aroma of grapefruit, tangerine and orange. Bittersweet citrus flavour of grapefruit, tangerine, orange, wheat and a hint of peach with a dry, bitter, hoppy finish. Medium body with a slick, oily texture and soft carbonation. Solid brew.

Keg at the Euston Tap - London. Pours clear gold with a creamy white head. Nice aroma, good dank and citrusy hops, melon, tangerine. Medium sweet flavor with pleasant mandarin orange, tangy peach, nectarine, more tangerine, some piney bitterness, oils. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Warming, oily and resinous in the finish, with ripe and juicy citrus hop character. Solid.

Draught. Almost clear deep golden liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, lemon peel, lemon drops, mango, tangerine and light caramel, light grain. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Pretty nice if a bit on the sweeter side.

Keg at Babajan, Stockholm.  Clear deep golden, small head. Tangerine and grapefruit up front. Mid sweet with medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Lots of citrus - grapefruit dominates. Some syrup and ripe fruit. Long bitter finish.
Tap at Pizza Luce. Clear amber with minimal white. Mellow citrus, apricot, caramel and toast. Has a lingering natural orange juice flavor. Body is medium with a crisp feel.

Draft. Poured clear copper color with an average frothy white head that was mostly lasting with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy complex citrus hop aroma. Medium to full body with slick texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy citrus bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration. Solid beer that exceeded my expectations.

Bottle much thanks to Dave. Pours out a decent orangy color with a small white head. Very nice aroma of dank hops, some pine, juicy citrus and sweet/tart blood orange. Taste tapers off from the aroma bur still solid. Nice dank hops, juicy citrus, fruits, tangy blood orange. The palate is a little light and Id like the intensity of the aroma to come over to the taste but still tasty.

Orange bright pour from draft at whole foods LP. White ring of head. Fresh squeeze fruit aroma - lemon lime and grapefruit. Amazing flavor. Tropical and citrus fruit bomb. Orange stands out. Smooth. Hint of vanilla. Outstanding beer. Best IPA I've had from Lagunitas perhaps.

On a road trip with the family. We stayed in South Dakota for a couple of days. This was about the only craft beer I could find on tap. It was refreshing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle - good size foamy head, mildly hazy medium copper color, good citrus hop aroma and flavor with some mild (was hoping for more but still good) blood orange notes, fair malt backbone, mildly bitter hop finish, very good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap, poured into a snifter. So much citrus pours from the beer into the nose. Its a very sweet and juicy aroma. It pours a murky orange with a dense white foam that  has okay lace and moderate retention. The taste is a medium high citrus bittersweet with maybe a touch more sweet upfront and more bitter at the tail. The texture is oily with lots of soft foam carbonation and a medium body. Its grassy, yet juicy, with almost all citrus qualities on the palate. It finishes with a citrus zip and some spice leaving a waxy citrus quality and notes of herbs and eventually, the aftertaste turns to sweet juice with an astringent waxy feel.

Bottle from bear world. Pours orange clear some head and minimal lacing. Nose is grapefruit and lemon rind. Flavours really punch with citrus rind, some cereal. Taste med bitter light/med sweet. Medium body lively carbonation lasting bitterness.

Pint at Tylers Apex. Good aroma, sweet, fruity, citrusy. Clean golden orange color, ok head and lace. Sweet bitter flavor.medium body creamy sticky mouthfeel, sweet finish. Very nice pale ale. Love the citrus.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text:
clear gold pour. aroma ozone, herbal hops. Tastes wheaty, slight citrus caramel malt slight grassy hops, muddy bready yeast, some moderate blood orange coming through, not the orange bomb people are describing - Ive had beer before that looked and tasted like orange soda.  This is not that beer.  This is a roughcut pale with added natural tasting orange flavor.

It is clashy in the malts, hops, and orange somehow though.  I think it would actually benefit from some big citrus hop flavors.

Bottle. Light golden hue with an airy, bright white head of thin foam. This beer overflows with sugary, sweet citrus, like a amplified fruit salad. Its light in body, but shockingly stark in that almost candy-like citric bite. (#6001, 7/12/2015)

This beer tastes freakin great. Big fresh fruit along w/massive hop presence. Lingering bitterness. The range of tropical fruit and blood orange rind is impressive. Hope this becomes a regular offering from Lagunitas.

On tap. Pours golden with a small white head. Aroma is of citrus, malt, and grass. More citrus in the nose than anything. Taste is of grassy hops and citrus. Has a dry, biscuity malt backbone. Lingering citrus. Body is light and very carbonated. Very crisp, and easy to drink. Its pretty good.
Bottle shared by Bill, pours hazy golden with white head. Notes are unbalanced with light blood orange. Candy orange sugars, booze, grain, and some twangy funk hop notes. Its alright

When you first sip this beer you definitely get a huge hint of orange peel. And it is a delicious citrus after taste. The color is orange and the taste is rad! Great beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A great aroma, very juicy, definite oranges in this mix. Its a nice color, but very dark, almost no head to speak of; the lack of a significant head may have been the glass it was poured into. The slight layer of foam is white with a small tint.
The first sip is tart, rounded with a malty foundation that sooths the initial bite, but leaves me with a odd aftertaste. Nothing spectacular about this for me, and, in fact, a bit of a bummer. I usually like Lagunitas for a go to beer, no matter the style, and this one wont make the list. Too much action, the combination of orange and malts is off-kilter, and the finish is lengthy and less than tasty. Not a Lagunitas brew that I would buy again.

Honey gold, a bit hazy. Bit citrus hop aroma. Taste- lemon and tangerine dominate lending to a sharp puckering sourness. Some malt but seems a bit unbalanced. I like citrusy pale ales but this is a bit much. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

In my life, Ive gone with the idea of mixing 2 beers together (black and tan), mixing beer and hard cider (snakebite), beer with sprite (radler) and beer with tomato juice (red one). All pretty acceptable on occasion, but the idea of pouring orange juice in my beer makes me feel queasy. Hats off to Lagunitas, probably my favorite brewery, but this one is not for me. Pours a nice watery orange juice color, smells of orange juice and tastes like... you guessed it. With beer in it. Ive sampled some Belgian sours, and while I dont love them, they are at least refreshing. This is not. It is, however, attracting fruit flies.

Slightly hazy gold pour with a one finger, creamy to soapy off white head that has good retention and tons of small to medium protein floaties. Aroma is citrus, sweet caramel, a little biscuit, light floral notes and bitter citrus. Flavor is bitter citrus (taste more like grapefruit than bitter orange), sweet citrus, light caramel, light biscuit and a sort of sickly orange flavor that seems to come up in almost anything that has orange juice fermented in it. Medium body, syrupy, slightly acidic feel, light to medium, spritzy carbonation. Not bad overall, the off orange flavors bring it down a decent amount overall. 7/4/7/3/14

Pours yellowish orange with a sudsy off-white head and lots of floaties. The aroma has lots of orange, lemon and tangerine. There is a good amount of sweet pale/caramel malt in the back and some grapefruit and piny hops giving a nice balance between all of the flavors. It has a medium / full mildly cloying body with a good amount of carbonation. The taste starts with a hefty semi-sweet malt base that has some grapefruit and orange balancing it off a bit. There is also a bit of spice and a bit of heat. Pretty nice IPA that rides somewhere in between a regular and double with lots of citrus.
Draft, blood orange, fairly middle of the road on bitterness. Juicy palate, medium length. Drinks like a shandy or a radler.
Get the blood orange, pretty tart. Not a good aftertaste for me. Lagunitas continues to underwhelm.
Got to like the citrus. Wheat lets it come through. Light golden with frothy head that holds and does a little lacing.

This has a strong citrus orange aroma. Nice color. This is quite delicious. Tons of orange and a general citrusy mouthfeel. At 8% its hard to think of this as a pale ale, but the citrus dominates the hops to the point where it doesnt taste like an IPA either. Excellent beer.

Aroma is not that great....my first thought was river water. Crisp taste, hardly any bite. A citrus bang at the end. Nice, but pale ales are just too week for me. I wouldn't get it again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden/orange in color with big , white head . Aroma of citrus and oranges literally smashed my nose. Juicy , fresh taste with some citrus sourness. Moderate , pleasant bitterness .

Absolutely loving this blood orange PA/IPA craze or fad going around right now. Lagunitas of course brings it proper with the perfect hop profile to fit the beautiful blast of citrus from the oranges. Excellent 6er beer.

12oz bottle. Wasnt citrusy enough so blood oranges in yo face! Mostly clear golden orange color and OH CRAP ITS PARTICULATE MATTER!!! OMG can I drink this? Is particulate matter going to kill me? I guess Ill risk it. The aroma is orangey like a mother. Some of it is good but some is orange. Blooooood orange. The flavor is an assault of blood orange juice. Its pretty mouth-puckering, and it adds bitterness to that of the hops. Very dry. The feel is like sucking on a blood orange, if it were stripped of sweetness and made more dry. Lovely carbo. Pretty cray-cray compared to your average brewski. This is interesting. I will give it high marks I suppose, although those floaties almost sent me to the hospital.

Draught. Pours a clear amber color with a moderate off white head on there. Nose is brightly filled with citrus and orange and the hops seems super fresh. Taste is only slightly bitter and has a sweet backbone, almost like a juice.

These citrus additions to APA and ipa are the latest in thing with Brewers and while the grapefruit additions have been a mixed bag thus far the blood orange additions have been very refreshing. This offering from łagunitas takes an ordinary pale ale and kicks it up a few notches. I think the orange works better with a hoppier ipa than a pale IMHO though this offering is enjoyable albeit a little sweeter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ The State (Redlands). Clear golden orange pour with a white head. Smells like a glass of orange and tangerine juice. Some grapefruit, peach, and sweet bread. Flavor is pretty citrus forward, not surprisingly. Lots of zesty and slightly pulpy orange juice. A mild tropical note, sort of a pineapple orange juice thing. Okay. Not as good as I hoped.
Pours a light bronze with medium white foam head; juicy grapefruit aromas; tart on the tongue like biting into a grapefruit. Interesting.

Poured from the six pack acquired from a limited stash at a secret location. Has a nice orange/ gold glow to it with a small white collar. Reminds me a bit of the new dogtown but stronger (+). Just enough blood orange to let you know its there, not overwhelming, and some peel bitter at the end. I will buy again if I see it, I hear its pretty limited.

Draft at Indigo. Pours a cloudy bright orange with a dense and creamy tan head. Huge bright forward oily dimensional grapefruit nose, showing tangy pink grapefruit, pith, rind, blood orange, just every detail of citric acid and fresh citric tree fruit that you can imagine. Delectable. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Soft sweet lightly toasted caramel under a steady wash of intense grapefruit and blood orange notes. Very refreshing and worth many repeats.
Gosh darn amazing beer that actually tastes like blood orange, that sweet sour citrus kind of flavor pairs well against wheaty malt body and light pine hops

Draft at Stone Tap, Hudson, WI. Nice orangey hop aroma. Slight orange hue to an otherwise gold brew. Packs a big time orangey flavor with almost some salt at the finish. A little cloying like many lagunitas brews.

At the Portland International Beerfest, Saturday June 25, 2015.Clear golden color, off-white head. Hoppy, pith taste. Hoppy, citrus aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, medium high bitterness. Hoppy, citrus scent.
Most of the orange is left on the palate, but theres a hint of it up front which balances the hops.
Orange with small head. Big nose of blood orange and hops. Tastes of blood orange, dank hops, caramel, bready, and grapefruit. Fine palate and beer

Pours a clear light rust orange. Has a very strong flor aroma with some citrus hops and pine. A sweet taste of citrus and floral hops with pine, grains, and some light spices. A surprisingly dry aftertaste from grains with some bitter hops.

12 oz bottle with a 162 5 date code. Sweet. Pours an extremely chunky light orange with a white head. Nose and flavor full of citrus notes, orange rind, and a clean bitter finish. As long as I dont look at the beer, its absolutely fantastic.

Poured from the bottle. Clear golden with lots of stuff floating in it, nice head. Aroma is definitely citrus orange. The hops and bitterness go perfectly with the citrus. Palate is some what medium body, not to thick and oily on this 100 degree day. Very tasty!

Pours orange amber with an ivory head. Aroma is heavy citrus, orange peel, pine and tangerine. Taste is a glorious mash of tropical fruits, blood orange, and citrusy bitter hops. Another winner from Lagunitas.
Pours bright orange Amber color with faint tiny bits floating around. Smells bright citrus orange zest some bitterness. Taste is bitter citrus and malty. Straight forward and pretty drinkable.

Loads of citrus hops, orange peel and lemon and orange juice, balanced with light caramel and toasted rye. Crisp hop bitterness and lemon peel finish. Notes of pine and resin. Delicious and refreshing.

Pours deep gold into a shaker. Bright white head with medium retention recedes to hug rim. Orange citrus and weed aromas. Sweet caramel and yeast upfront turning blood orange and resin before the lasting pith finish.

On tap at Gourmet Haus Staudt in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is spiced hops, earthy citrus peels, tangerines. Taste is tangy orange / tartish grapefruit. Very tangy, sour, fresh with moderate hop bitterness. Loving these citrus twists on IPAs this summer (next of kin: Fieldwork Sea Farmer).

homerun for lagunitas. draft pour at stocks and blondes. Pours light orange in color with a thick orange color head. the head tastes like oranges. unbelievable balance of hopps and tangerine flavors. one of the most crushable beers of the summer. i want a 6 pack.

On tap at Dutchs. Clear golden orange color. Bigger white head, with good retention. Leaves great ridges of lace. Definitely a big citrus burst up front, and through the flavor. Big blood orange, nice spicy peppery hop, and some biscuity bready malt. Light to moderate bitter, moderate to bigger sweet taste, kind of tangy. Medium to bigger body. Smooth, kind of crisp lighter carbonation. Sort of slick finish. Pretty damn tasty, well-done, interesting stuff. Nice to enjoy with my sub.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a Lagunitas glass 06.29.15. A: Lots of orange. Some pine and pineapple. A: 1 finger head that recedes to a small ring. Hazy light orange body with a lot of floating clumps. T: Orange and red grapefruit juice dominate. Pine and candied pineapple are subtle. P: Very crisp and refreshing. Bubbles come on almost immediately and stay throughout. O: This does not drink like 7.9%. Its super addictive too. I wanted to drink the whole pack, but had to stop to save some for later.
(tap) clear, orange amber colour with a small beige head; aroma of citrus, orange; balanced flavour with a long, light sour finish
Bottle. Pours clear golden with white head. Nose and taste is big blood orange. A little one dimensional.

Not bad. Bottle to glass. The blood orange is big in the taste, not as much in the aroma, but you do get a lot of general citrus in the nose, with a lesser amount of pine and hops.

Refreshing, well balanced, nice carbonation.

The Sourness starts to wear on me as I drink more.

Nothing crazy, but just different enough to make it intresting.
a dank pale/ipa that is bitter first, but then the wave of orange hits you. aroma opens up nicely as does the flavor. well balanced between bitter and sweet.
On tap at Final Gravity. Pours lclear golden with a nice white head and a citrus aroma. There is a very dry and slightly sour orange and wheat flavor. Extreme citrus.

Bottle from LifeSource. Hazy medium golden in color. A ton of sediment floating about. Highly hopped nose of citrus with a bit of sweetness. Somewhat sweet and hoppy up front. Some spiced hoppiness. Lots of grapefruit peel. Pretty tasty.

Smells like a pale ale with orange juice poured into it, orange peels. Flavor is the same. The finish is heavy citrus, like juice, the apearance is clear amber, white head. Medium in body. Not really enjoyable.

Holy fuck this beer is awesome. Pours a soft and vibrant golden orange with a fair amount of colloidal suspension. Two fingers of off white head. Nose is absolutely boss, bright and juicy citrus and fruit with tons of citrus rind, green hops, tropical fruit, orange, and the slightest hint of onion. Sick flavor, orange and juicy citrus with fruit and just plain awesomeness. Very moderate and balanced bitterness with citrus rind on the finish and a round citrusy sweetness.

Pours a very pale yellow, with little to no head. Aroma is very catboxish, with pine and citrus notes. Flavor is kind of grassy, some citrus (though not what you might expect with all the blood orange additions), and a touch of bitter hops. Its good, but not great.

Draft at Ei8ht Ball. Pours a hazy golden color with a medium sized, creamy off white head. The aroma has citrus and dank hop character. The flavor has dank, earthy hops, blood orange citrus, moderate bitterness, very fruity, someppale toasted malts, good, not great.
Too sweet for me. More like a cider than beer...just not for me.......................

Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is fresh citrus orange with dank pine resin. Flavor is big citrus up front with blood orange juice and a little metallic bite. Some grapefruit In the middle. Finishes with big grapefruit rind and dank pine resin. This is easily the top blood orange IPA Ive had. Really nice . The blood orange juice and the hops used blend nicely.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2016 Bottle, thanks Darsh. Aroma and taste is all citrus juice. Super smooth though goes down really easy. Re-rate 4/19/16 - Had this a few more times.  Just too much orange juice for me to love it but its still decent.

12oz bottle from Dave. Pours a clear golden color with a small fluffy white head. Aroma of sweet orange, grapefruit, peaches, pine, caramel, and wet grain. Taste mimics the nose with the addition of sour blood orange and lemons in there as well.
bottle. golden orange with one finger head. smells hoppier than it is. blood orange comes through nicely. very citrusy with low bitterness. very well done.
On tap at Rosso. Pours a yellow amber color with a bit of head. Some dankness and noticeable orange flavor.
On tap at The Hop in Beacon NY. Pours a light Amber. Oranges, strawberry, wheat and fresh hop
Shared 12oz to snifters. Slight wheat haze. Orange yellow. Refreshing citrus hops with a tangy grapefruit like tart middle and a sweet orange finish.

On draught at the PIB. Colour...clear golden-orange with a thin white head. Nose...quite fruity with both citrus and vinifera white grapes. Palate...light and frothy with tangy fruits and notes of grain. The hops are present and have more of that grape-like flavour. The finish is long and tangy.

12oz bottle via 6pack from Spirits Brick. Poured a mostly clear rusty gold with a few large clinging bubbles and an average sized frothy white head that quickly dissappear. Aroma seems to be a battle between dank hops and juicy blood orange, along with wet toast. Flavor of bitter citrus rind, wet grass, dank hops, dough, grapefruit juice. Not sure why but the dank hops vs the sweet blood orange doesnt work for me. Still a good beer.

On tap at The Beer Mongers, pours a clear copper orange with a small white head. Nose brings out lots of citrus and dry biscuity malt. Flavour is similar, with loads of juicy citrus and oranges, and just enough biscuity malt. Superbly balanced and loads of flavour. Excellent.
Pours orange with a white head. Blood orange, tangerine, mango, hop and floral aroma and flavors. Medium body and carbonation with a juicy blood orange and tangerine finish.
Pours a cloudy copper orange with beige head. Pretty dank aroma with some juicy orange. Taste follows the nose with more grapefruit.

Bottle - Pours golden orange with a filmy off-white head. Nose is super orangey and citrusy with dank, oniony hops and a light, dry malt base. Taste is the same, with lots of dank hops and a light citrus sheen. Fluffy and light body with a mellow carbonation. Tasty stuff and reminds me a bit of Grapefruit Sculpin.

12oz bottle - huge blood orange aroma , slightly sweet , tart finish . Not bad .

Great ipa. This beer has an amazing orange taste and such well balanced. Very enjoyable ale.

Roseville Total Wine bottle. Light, clear copper color with a small white head. Huge aroma of dank hops plus orange and pink grapefruit citrus notes. Really cool flavor that is centered around the sharp twang of blood oranges but finishes with a lingering bitterness. Pretty cool.

Pours a gold color. Clear with lots of chunky floaters that look like pulp. Very citrus orange hop aroma. The thinnest of white heads with zero lacing. Taste is citrus, pith, grass. Feels like a wheat IPA.

12 oz bottle poured. Pours a clear golden color with a fading foam head. Super citrusy orange aroma. Very juicy pale here, and very sweet, with a citrus bomb throughout. Almost enough to be a fruit beer, going off taste along. Sweet, citrus hops finish. Overall very tasty. Now ill get back to the challenging task of trying to pronounce the name of this beer.
Amber. Nose of deep, dank citrus, lemon, and orange. Flavor is orange with bitter citrus rind and bright citrus peel. Some malt backing. Lingering bitter citrus. Love me some Lagunitas.

Draft. Translucent tangerine with a wispy white cap. The aroma is like an orange fallen to earth -- zesty peel met with moist earth. Dollops of honey and dank weed round the bouquet out. The flavor is almost sour with tongue-clasping blood orange acidity, but becomes slightly more balanced mid-palate as the brews citrusy hops rise. The orange addition is just slightly distracting, and a splash more juice would make it unpleasant. Its an interesting twist on one of my Lagunitas favorites, but not one that I think Id enjoy more than a glass of.

Bottle pour. The beer is a cloudy copper color with a white head of foam. The beer has a tremendous citrus quality and a mild bitter, rindy quality. Lots of juicy citrus character here. Sweet mostly, but has some drying qualities as well. Medium bodied and medium carbonation. Deliciius beer!

12oz bottle from Gentiles in Grandview: murky orange pour with a sturdy off-white head. aroma is big - with tropical fruit, dank, weed, grass, pineapple, cracker, floral. tastes are the full spectrum of tropical fruit - orange, grapefruit, pineapple, lemon. also sweet caramel, wheat and a juicy tartness. there is a dank oniony vibe that luckily (for my tastes anyway) gets drowned out by the sweet citrus. yup, big fan.

12 oz. bottle. It pours a bright orange color with a good amount of floaties and a shrinking white head. The aroma is, not surprisingly, very fruity and juicy with orange and grapefruit. Not much else other than some mild grass and florals. The flavor is the same. Big time orange, grapefruit, grass. Full bodied and fruity sweet. Orange gummies. Prickly carbonation and mild/medium bitterness. Pretty tasty, but rather simple.

This misses the mark for me. Came for the blood orange, left because of the grapefruit. It's also a bit catty and dank which is right up some peoples alley but not mine. Quality beer that's not for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Good to be #10. Bottle from The Davis Beer Shoppe. "2015 OneHitter Series". Pours orange gold with a slight white head. Lots of citrus aroma - but it doesnt bite. A little dankness. Med body or so. Flavor is a mix of dank and fresh citrus -which isnt lemon or lime, so must be orange. The dank tends to displace the citrus and coat the tongue. The "juice" part is very fresh. With time things seem more orange to me. Its certainly a change. Just noticed I didnt notice malt. Hmm. The juice and hop seem to have obliterated it for the most part. Time to stop. I think one hit is about right. I dont feel Id want to drink a great deal of this. But ......
Sharp citrus aroma lemon and tangerine, pretty golden, light white foam. Touch of dank. Lemon drop, candy aroma, acidic sweet. Touch of protein feel. Interesting.
355ml bottle. Orange/gold pour. This has a very noticeable and correct blood orange flavor, but the beer backing it falls short. Decent but not amazing.
A lot of citrus smell a little white head down to a nice lacing show. Taste of lemon and orange. Sits OK on the palate. Very intresting brew
Strong grapefruit and pine aroma. Quite citrusy on the palate, with a good balance of hops. Blood orange color and big frothy white head. Quality brew!!

Aroma is strong grapefruit/citrus, hops and a hint of wheat. The flavor is orange/grapefruit, hops/mild hop resin, almost pulpy texture, a hint of wheat and a mix of bitter and slight but there heat in the finish.

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass. bottled on 6/4/2015. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy deep golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense off white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with some light streaming carbonation. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, lemon zest, orange peel, pine, honey, cracker, bread, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great complexity and balance of bright citrus/piney hops, blood orange, and pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, lemon zest, orange peel, pine, honey, cracker, bread, and floral/grassy earthiness. Fair amount of pine/grassy bitterness and slight fruit tartness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, lemon/orange peel, pine, honey, cracker, bread, and floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of bright citrus/piney hops, blood orange, and pale malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness/tartness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, fairly crisp/sticky, and slightly acidic mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is an excellent fruited pale ale. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/piney hops, blood orange, and pale malt flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering.

On tap at Chicago taproom, pours a clear golden/copper with a thin white head. Resinous hop aroma, dry caramel malt and pencil shavings. Crisp sweet citrus orange, dry resinous dank citrus, and light caramel malt with a sneaky steady bitterness. Blood orange beers seem to be the new thing, this was the best so far.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2015 Draft at the Lagunitas Beer Circus Chicago. Oh, the orange juice is right there in the nose, followed by the slightly catbox smell of Citra hops. Orangey in color, no doubt. Rich and juicy flavor, about half from Orange juice and half hops. Can be a bit of a palate burner, but then theres that orange crush finish to mellow out.

On tap at the brewery. From the bartender - this is Little Sumpin Sumpin with blood oranges.....holy cow!!! Massive, MASSIVE orange on the nose! Also contains a massive amount of grapefruit! An absolute citrus explosion in an amazing way! Appearance is hazy orange with white head. Head dissipates to just a collar ringing the glass, but the top of the glass retained very nice patterns from the head. Taste is orange and overt grapefruit! Fresh fruit and a semi-dry finish, with moderate to moderate low bittering. I have never understood the buzz behind Grapefruit Sculpin....and that is because I think that beer should taste as awesome as this one!
